intro: Thesium hispidulum var. subglabrum, commonly known as the rough thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
